text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
thank you
hello I'm Francisco a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Dublin
today we'll be talking about the reasons
for the sufficient daily state in Amazon
Cloud watch alarms
let's get started
when you configure an alarm or you have
your alarm set in place you might see
the alarm State flipped entering
sufficient data
this state might be the result of these
conditions
an Amazon Cloud watch alarm just started
the metric is unavailable
the metric parameters like namespace
metric name or Dimensions have been
misconfigured
there is not enough data for the metric
to determine the alarm state
now I have my testing alarm that I just
created a few minutes ago and I can see
that it's stuck in this sufficient daily
State because of normal metric Behavior
generally there are two types of metrics
based on how they are pushed to Cloud
watch period driven and event-driven
one sense periodic data points to their
metrics at regular intervals the other
pushes metric data when triggered by
certain events
I have the default CPU realization
metric of my Amazon elastic compute
Cloud instance as an example of period
driven metric and the HTTP code
elb5xx count metric for an application
load balancer as an example of an
event-driven metric
if I configure treat missing data points
as not breaching then the alarm state is
forcibly updated to ok
the same logic applies to setting trade
missing data points as breaching
changing this value flips its state to
alarm
some incorrect Cloud watch alarm
settings might also cause the wrong
alarm state
always check the namespaces metric names
and dimension keys and values before
retrieving a data point
also be sure that you use the correct
unit if the data points in your metric
have multiple of them
note that incorrectly configure alarm
periods might also be the reason why you
get undesired States
check the period when the data points of
the metric are pushed and make sure that
it's equal to or shorter than the alarm
spirit that you have specified
data points can be delivered late due to
many reasons such as connectivity issues
and so on
at this stage the alarm can't retrieve
any data points for those evaluation
periods this condition triggers any
sufficient data state
after recovering connectivity the alarm
retrieves the recent data points based
on the period and evaluation period that
you specified
to summarize a bit when your alarm is
unexpectedly in the sufficient daily
state it might indicate
the alarm is nearly created the cloud
watch alarm settings are incorrect
the alarm periods are incorrect the data
points delivery is delayed
if you don't want to see this alarm
State offering sufficient data then be
sure that you change how the alarm
treats missing data
and now you know the reasons for the
sufficient daily state in Amazon Cloud
watch alarms
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
